description: This course introduces students to the complicated relationship between philosophy and
literature from any period between the 16th-century and the present day. Students learn
about the intersection of ideas that fall under the general category of "modernity" and
explore how selected philosophical views influence American and/or English literary works
from the Renaissance to the contemporary period. Students gain an understanding of modern
philosophies by learning how to incorporate interdisciplinary theories when engaging in
literary analysis. Offered periodically. Prerequisite: FYW.
